header.gameNote: America East Men's Championship - 1st Round AT VESTAL NY

article.headline: Stony Brook 73, Maine 65
article.story: VESTAL, N.Y. (AP) -- Ricky Lucas had 18 points, six rebounds and four steals in a play-in game Friday night to lead Stony Brook to a 73-65 overtime win over Maine and a spot in the America East Tournament quarterfinals. Three Seawolves scored in double figures off the bench: Nick Carter had 16 points, Demetrius Young had 15 points and 10 rebounds, and Mitchell Beauford had 11 points including four in overtime. The eighth-seeded Seawolves (7-22, 3-0 against Maine) will play regular season-champion Maryland-Baltimore County (21-8) in the first of the four games Saturday. Maine, seeded ninth, ended its season with seven straight losses, 10 in the last 11 games to finish at 7-23. Stony Brook wiped out an 11-point second-half deficit and held Maine without a field goal for most of the final 9:46, leading by three in the closing seconds. But Mark Socoby banked home a 3-pointer from beyond the top of the key with 4.2 seconds remaining to force overtime. The Seawolves, who used an 8-0 run to tie the game at 50-50 with 6:32 left in regulation, quickly broke the game open in overtime, where they went 8-for-8 from the foul line to send home the Black Bears, guilty of 20 turnovers. Socoby had two 3-pointers for Maine in overtime and finished with a career-high 30 points.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
